" Another Donald Rumsfeld nemesis, as painted in these pages, was Deputy Secretary of State Richard Armitage . "His leaks were so brazen," Donald Rumsfeld writes, that he told Colin Powell to manage his deputy: Rich Richard Armitage has been badmouthing the Pentagon all over town. It's been going on for some time and it's only gotten worse... I don't know what the hell is in Richard Armitage 's craw, but I'm tired of it. Colin Powell , in turn, expressed concern that Donald Rumsfeld 's deputy, Paul Wolfowitz , "was leaking against him" - which Donald Rumsfeld says he did not believe. Andy Coulson one degree of separation to the McCann affair: McCann family spokesman Clarence Mitchell joins CCHQ as head of media monitoring for the election www.prweek.com PR Week has the story: The Conservative Party has signed up Clarence Mitchell , best-known as spokesman for Madeleine McCann's parents, as the head of media monitoring for its general election campaign, PRWeek can exclusively reveal. " Clarence Mitchell joins the Tory comms operation today, reporting directly to director of communications Andy Coulson . Clarence Mitchell , who was the director of the Government's media monitoring unit for two years( 2005-2007) will take a back room role, monitoring the progress of the Tories' campaign in the media. that statues of U.S. Presidents and founding fathers sold in the Smithsonian gift shop are made in China. Senator Bernie Sanders has written the Smithsonian urging it to find an American manufacturer for historical souvenirs. If a museum owned by the people of America, a museum which talks about our own history, can not have products in the states manufactured by American workers we've got some very, very serious problems, Bernie Sanders says. In deciding who should take the business forward, we wanted someone with the right mix of leadership, vision and hard-core engineering chops," chief executive Steve Ballmer wrote in an email to company employees that Microsoft published. We wanted someone who could define the future of business computing and further expand our ability to bring the cloud to business customers and developers in game-changing ways. One of the feathers in Satya Nadella 's cap includes leading the technical efforts on the launch of Microsoft's Bing search engine, new releases of MSN, and the integration of Yahoo! across Bing and adCenter.
